title: Two wooden typefaces
content:
Hi!  
I'm the guy that was restoring an archive of wooden typefaces from southern Italy.

I have some new proofprints of some of our typefaces, please take a look if you have any clue on their ID!

thanks  
A.

ps - I've built a proof press, soon I'll show you some pictures of it!

| Attachment | Size |
| --- | --- |
| [viennesebozza.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019174705/http:/typophile.com/files/viennesebozza.jpg) | 244.48 KB |
| [posterbozza.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019174705/http:/typophile.com/files/posterbozza.jpg) | 237.42 KB |
| [futurabozza.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019174705/http:/typophile.com/files/futurabozza.jpg) | 263.92 KB |
author: earthache

comments.content:
Viennesebozza matches an old font sold as Titania or Klarissa. Here is the Solotype version of Titania:

 ![](http://web.archive.org/web/20131019174705im_/http:/typophile.com/files/Titania_4652.jpg)

Don

Thanks for the fast responses!

The futurabozza seems like a vernacular copy of futura to me...
